meanings.definition: To boast more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She always tries to outboast her friends about her achievements.
meanings.sent2: He tends to outboast others when talking about his accomplishments.
meanings.sent3: At the party, everyone laughed when she tried to outboast the comedian.
meanings.sent4: His stories of adventure outboast even the wildest imaginations.
meanings.sent5: The peacock's colorful feathers outboast all other birds in the forest.

meanings.sent1: The athlete managed to outboast his competitors with his record-breaking performance.
meanings.sent2: She always tries to outboast her friends about her achievements.
meanings.sent3: The little boy's attempt to outboast his older brother was met with laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence outboasts her actual abilities.
meanings.sent5: The sun's brilliance outboasts all the stars in the night sky.
